subject: Boxing
Olympic Games
lead_paragraph: The bantamweight Gary Russell Jr. and the featherweight Raynell Williams qualified for the Olympics with convincing victories and increased the United States team’s momentum at the World Boxing Championships in Chicago. Russell outpointed his fellow 2005 world bronze medalist Ali Hallab of France, 22-14, in the Round of 16, and Williams led by 23-3 when his bout with Azat Hovhannisyan of Armenia was stopped in the third round. No United States boxer has won a gold medal at the worlds since 1999, but the Americans are 18-3 and in good position to end the drought.
